title: Why did David Thoreau stop living at Walden Pond? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thoreau gives an answer in the last chapter of Walden - “I left the woods for as good a reason as I went there. Perhaps it seemed to me that I had several more lives to live, and could not spare any more time for that one. It is remarkable how easily and insensibly we fall into a particular route, and make a beaten track for ourselves.” I read this as he had learned what he needed from his experiment and was bored.

In the comments of the translator in the polish version of this book, I found out that direct reason why Thoreau moved away from Walden was Emersons request to take care for his house and family. Emerson was leaving a broad to give there lectures.
